page.title: 01SNAITH PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
Snaith County Primary School has its origins as a Methodist Day School. It can be traced back to 1849 through the Log Books still retained in the School. The first Headteacher was one John Graham. The school remained in its original buildings until 1976 when the present school was opened.
Extract from the Log. March 10th 1863. Wedding of Prince of Wales. The children received from a general fund a medal, an orange and a bun and were addressed ( the other school in the town was present ) by Rev J.H Rees and Rev C. Hawthorne.
